job_title: Student Leader in University Place, WA
pros: A perfect part time job for students that enhances career and leadership skills. Working for the OSE (Office of Student Engagement) challenges you to be a leader shaping the campus community.
cons: If you don't have a mind to work with a diverse and outgoing workplace, it's not the job for you. 🤷

review_title: A good place to land but not an easy place to stay
job_title: Senior Program Manager in Tacoma, WA
pros: Many great people-truly dedicated; innovative; committed to equity; excellent instruction; lots of autonomy
cons: Leadership doesn't appreciate what and/or who they have before chasing the next "best" thing; some very poor hiring decisions at the top; too political in some areas-at the expense of what's best for students; easy to burn out because there is no consistent recognition or feedback

pros: Strong focus on student sucess. Focus on DEI and provided good trainings.
cons: Hard to move positions or up

job_title: Outreach and Recruitment Specialist in Tacoma, WA
pros: -My manager was amazing and always encouraging
cons: -Higher leadership was passive-aggressive about budget issues and would make subtle threats about employees being at will

pros: Flexibility with hours, friendly coworkers, convenient for students.
cons: Limitations with hours, no long-range growth

pros: Co-workers and supervisors are awesome to work with
cons: Hours are limited to your status as a student

review_title: Wish I would have quit sooner
pros: Convenient location, near my home
cons: Completely dysfunctional organization. The worst job I've ever had.

job_title: College and Career Center Coordinator in Tacoma, WA
pros: Student focused, team orientated and opportunities for advancement.
cons: Pay for certain positions is a bit low.

pros: Friendly employees, love the guest and distributors!
cons: 10-12 hour shifts with little organization. They said one thing did another

job_title: Instructional Lab Assistant in Tacoma, WA
pros: Great people to work with! Caring people. Paid sick leave. Opportunity to learn
cons: Low pay for having a bachelor's degree. Only 72 hours max per month. During covid no other benefits. Usually benefits include use of gym, library free. No other benefits.

job_title: Customer Service Specialist in Tacoma, WA
pros: friendly atmosphere, great co-workers, clean
cons: Senior managers, poor cafeteria, carpet

pros: Great community and coworkers. The college cares about the students. Fair pay for faculty.
cons: Lack of transparency. Need more flexibility for non-faculty staff.

pros: Flexibility of Hours, Collaborative environment within team and other departments
cons: Needs better salary for workload, outdated processes

pros: Staff cares about providing an excellent experience for students
cons: No cons, everything in my experience was positive

pros: Nice infrastructure and very supportive staff and faculty
cons: Low pay for the amount of work

pros: Professional development opportunities are frequent and widespread
cons: Some infighting and management issues make faculty nervous

job_title: Information Technology Professor in Tacoma, WA
pros: The students are good to work with. Teaching them what I know and seeing the light bulb come on is a great experience. Medical benefits and matching 401K are good, if you can get enough working hours to qualify for the benefits.
cons: The state wants to keep a high level of adjunct or non-tenure professors, in order to reduce their expenditures of benefits such as medical and retirement. I believe it is also the will of the college. Communication is also lacking. Being, technically, employed for 5 years and only actually in the classroom for 50% of those 5 years and not being given any answers, I finally severed my employment.

pros: There are quite a few people who are very happy there and brighten the work environment. The salary and benefits were also pretty competitive for the area.
cons:
Some buildings are extremely outdated and it's awful to work in them. The kitchen was located a foot away from the women's bathroom, so when you were preparing your lunch, you could hear people literally using the restroom. 

This company is afraid to innovate and try new things. They've been doing things the same way for the past 20 years and aren't looking to change them whatsoever. There's also a huge lack of motivation from all of the staff.

pros: Fun, get to know people from different backgrounds and great opportunity to learn about different cultures. I'm a full time student who work part time, but my supervisors are very flexible about my schedules. I like working here, everyone gets along well and very close to each other.
cons: I'm a part-time and I was forced to join the union which I didn't want to. They took out money from my paycheck, a full time student from different school, who works part-time here. The union is ripping off my small paycheck.

pros: Great job if you need something part time while a student. It is slightly above minimum wage and the people are fairly friendly to work with.
cons: They have a limit on how many hours that tutors can work because they are not willing to give any benefits, even to their most seasoned tutors. It is a shame, because some of them definitely deserve it. They also have a wage lock, meaning that you cannot get a raise no matter how long you work for them.

review_title: Good place to work as a part-time employee and student. I can't speak for the full-time staff and instructors
pros:
Great understanding of the need to have time off to study for mid terms and finals
Friendly co-workers
Relaxed dress code
cons:
Management doesn't listen to the needs of the students at times
lack of benefits for part-timers
Inability to work over 14 hours per week for part-timers

review_title: Middle Management makes it worth it.
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Tacoma, WA
pros: engage with the public, assist students in reaching their academic goals, reasonable hours, supportive staff members, opportunity to grow in your profession.
cons: Allowed a maximum of 17 hours of work per week and no more than 69 hours per month. Non-competitive wage.

review_title: Being a Math Tutor was a Fun & Great Experience
pros: Flexible work hours, continued training in how to improve tutoring, nice & relaxed work environment
cons: Not a job you would want to have forever, as there is really no advancement other than becoming the tutoring center's manager. The tutoring service is free and as a result you can sometimes get slammed at the end of the quarter/ have to tutor people you would otherwise turn away if it was a service I was selling.

review_title: Math Advising and Resource Center Tutoring
pros: I love working here.  My boss is really caring and understanding.  It is really easy to get your shift covered. It really helps you stay on top of your math.
cons: I average about 12-15 hours per week. When there is no school there is no work

job_title: Laboratory Stockroom Assistant in Tacoma, WA
pros: Flexible scheduling, diverse tasks, decent pay. A good job if you are enrolled in school.
cons: Employer limits hours to part time to avoid paying benefits. Management unorganized. Transfers to different teams without notice or asking employees if they are okay with it.

job_title: Human Resources Consultant in Tacoma, WA
pros: Empowerment, Autonomy, Progression in Culture of Workplace, Courteous, Supportive, Learning Environment
cons: Slow speed to changes specific to department, Pay structure is not as competitive as private industry, not a lot of regularly schedule one on one coaching relevant to job performance, feedback is often reactive

review_title: An Institution dedicated to student's  and employee's success and advancement.
pros: Good opportunities for growth. Use the tuition exemption waiver to take classes at UWT.
cons: The different departments could work together a bit better by understanding the needs faced when things we cut back during the recession.

review_title: I had fun as a tutor in Math Center
pros: Lots of support and opportunities for professional development.
cons: The pay isn't in line with the skills of a math tutor, but it's not a career and most tutors were students themselves.

pros: Able to design my own courses, loved my students
cons: There was no pay for prep time or if students needed help after class.  Also, they gave me inappropriate rooms for the types of classes I was teaching.

Medical

Low pay for On call-

pros: Benefits available for adjuncts; centrally located office
cons: Inflated adjunct to full time ratio, but that's a problem EVERYWHERE

pros: Works really well with your class schedule/fun environment to work in/get to meet and interact with great people
cons: No room for advancement/benefits/not enough hours

Flexible day Job.
Relaxed environment, staff easy to get along with
